caption.p: Projected Arctic rainfall changes attributed to changes in local temperature, for annual mean (top), summer (JJA, June-July-August; bottom left) and winter (DJF, December-January-February; bottom right). 100% percent means that the increase in rainfall can be totally attributed to local warming. Yellow dots in the top panel show the locations (one on the North Pole and one in the North Atlantic) used in Fig.Â 4.
